alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 3:39PM CDT until October 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following counties, Boyd, Brown, Holt, Keya Paha and Rock. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bassett, Stuart, Long Pine, Newport, Mariaville, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge and Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
